com.tomeraberbach.mano.simulation

Class Computer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomeraberbach.mano.simulation.Computer

  • public class Computer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing Mano's computer as detailed in:
    Computer System Architecture, 3rd edition
    By M. Morris Mano
    Published by Prentice-Hall, c 1993
    Chapter 5, pp 123-172.

      • validateValue

        public static void validateValue(int value,
                                 int size)
        Parameters:
        value - Unsigned integer value to check if it can be represented with size bits.
        size - Integer number of bits to check if value can be represented by.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if calling isValidValue(int, int) results in false.

      • isValidValue

        private static boolean isValidValue(int value,
                                    int size)
        Parameters:
        value - Unsigned integer value to check if it can be represented with size bits.
        size - Integer number of bits to check if value can be represented by.
        Returns:
        boolean representing if value can be represented with size bits.

        Parameters:

      • validateDigit

        public static void validateDigit(int digit,
                                 int size)
        Parameters:
        digit - Binary digit index to check the validity of in a binary representation consisting of size bits.
        size - Integer number of bits for which to check digit is a valid index of.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if calling isValidDigit(int, int) results in false.

                                    int size)
        Parameters:

        size - Integer number of bits for which to check digit is a valid index of.
        Returns:

      • bit

        public static boolean bit(int digit,
                          int value)
        Parameters:
        digit - The least to most significant zero-based binary digit index of value to get.
        value - Integer value to get the digitth bit of.
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the binary digit at index digit of value is a 1.

        Parameters:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this Computer to its initial state which was right after its instantiation using Computer().

      • tick

        public void tick()
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the next batch Microoperation instances to be executed and adds them to this microoperations. sc is incremented at the end of this method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when s is unasserted.
